result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  REST

supervisions.notes: Must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate and follow through with recommendations.  Be complian with any child support obligations that still exist.  Do not associate, unless in treatment and continued cooperation with the State, with anyone that has a previous drug conviction.  May have contact with victims and should apologize.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.

**CORRECTED 4/9/2018: To reflect total credit for time served as 347 days.**

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.  Defendant Charles J Phillips in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Charles J Phillips in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has read the revocation packet and has no additions or corrections, is Chapter 950 compliant.
Defense read the revocation packet and wanted to address the pre-sentencing credit.
BTC:  Accounting will be done and it may be brought back to court if defense disagrees.

State requests 4 years (2 years IC & 2 years ES) on each case, consecutive.
Defense requests 4 years (2 years IC & 2 years ES) on each case, concurrent.

BTC:  on 14CF1536:  4 years WPS (2 years IC & 2 years ES)
no alcohol or C/S unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment and aftercare, and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
full time employment
NO CIP
SAT eligible
Restitution of $1,792.69 
firearms/voting warnings given

on 15CF29:  WPS 3 years (2 years IC & 1 year ES)
same conditions
Consecutive to 14CF1536

Costs including DNA assmt
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting
atty McClendon
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 15, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
atty Cohen

Defendant Charles J Phillips in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties ask for adj of sentencing. Parties have agreed on the adj  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ALONG WITH $250.00 SIGNATURE BOND. Ct 1: 943.20(1)(a)-Theft/Movable Property. No contact with victim's person, property, residence or family.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**CORRECTION 7-21-2015:  Per Atty. Hamad, motion to withdraw as counsel was with withdrawn on record at hearing on 7-17-2015.  lkh**
